content.text: I'll help you implement the highest value item from tasks.md. Let me start by reading the current specifications and reviewing the project structure.

1â†’# V0 MVP Tasks - AI Content Pipeline
     2â†’
     3â†’## ğŸ¯ V0 SCOPE: Zoom â†’ YouTube â†’ AI Drafts â†’ Web UI
     4â†’**Focus**: Turn Zoom recordings into unlisted YouTube videos + 3 AI-generated text drafts (email, X, LinkedIn) with human review/editing UI.
     5â†’
     6â†’---
     7â†’
     8â†’## ğŸ“‹ BACKEND TASKS (Python + FastAPI)
     9â†’
    10â†’### 1. Core Dependencies & Setup
    11â†’- [x] Add missing dependencies to `pyproject.toml`:
    12â†’  - [x] `uvicorn[standard]` (ASGI server)
    13â†’  - [x] `python-multipart` (file uploads)
    14â†’  - [x] `httpx` (HTTP client for APIs)
    15â†’  - [x] `python-dotenv` (environment variables)
    16â†’  - [x] `supabase` (database client)
    17â†’  - [x] `google-auth` + `google-auth-oauthlib` (YouTube API)
    18â†’  - [x] `google-api-python-client` (YouTube upload)
    19â†’  - [x] `baml-py` (AI client)
    20â†’- [x] Create `.env` template with required secrets
    21â†’- [x] Set up basic FastAPI app structure with CORS
    22â†’- [x] implement all endpoints with no logic, just return dummy data, to get the contract baked so frontend devs can start working, we'll fill in the endpoints as we go
    23â†’  - [x] `POST /videos/import` - Queue Zoom download
    24â†’  - [x] `GET /videos/{id}` - Get video details + drafts
    25â†’  - [x] `POST /videos/{id}/summarize` - Trigger Gemini pipeline
    26â†’  - [x] `GET /videos/{id}/summary` - Get summary points
    27â†’  - [x] `GET /videos/{id}/drafts` - List draft history
    28â†’  - [x] `POST /videos/{id}/drafts` - Save edited drafts
    29â†’  - [x] `POST /drafts/{id}/feedback` - Add feedback
    30â†’
    31â†’### 2. Database Schema & Supabase Setup
    32â†’- [ ] Create Supabase project
    33â†’- [ ] Implement database schema (videos, drafts, feedback tables)
    34â†’- [ ] Set up Supabase client configuration
    35â†’- [ ] Add RLS policies for user isolation
    36â†’
    37â†’### 3. OAuth Integration (for localhost ONLY)
    38â†’- [ ] Implement Zoom OAuth flow - we'll use a server token from ZOOM_API_KEY and other needed things - consult me when you're ready for these things - output instructions for how to get the key
    39â†’- [ ] Implement Google/YouTube OAuth flow - just use a google_credentials file that I'll provide, and walk me through the local oauth flow to get the tokens.json file locally, and just store it (use refresh token in the token json before making calls)
    40â†’
    41â†’### 4. Core API Endpoints
    42â†’implement each endpoint one at a time, test with curl
    43â†’
    44â†’- [ ] `POST /videos/import` - Queue Zoom download
    45â†’- [ ] `GET /videos/{id}` - Get video details + drafts
    46â†’- [ ] `POST /videos/{id}/summarize` - Trigger Gemini pipeline
    47â†’- [ ] `GET /videos/{id}/summary` - Get summary points
    48â†’- [ ] `GET /videos/{id}/drafts` - List draft history
    49â†’- [ ] `POST /videos/{id}/drafts` - Save edited drafts
    50â†’- [ ] `POST /drafts/{id}/feedback` - Add feedback
    51â†’
    52â†’### 5. Video Processing Pipeline
    53â†’- [ ] Download Zoom recording to backend
    54â†’- [ ] Upload video to YouTube as unlisted
    55â†’- [ ] Extract video metadata (title, duration, etc.)
    56â†’- [ ] Store video info in database
    57â†’
    58â†’### 6. AI Integration (BAML)
    59â†’- [ ] Set up BAML client configuration
    60â†’- [ ] Create prompt templates for:
    61â†’  - Video summarization (bullet points)
    62â†’  - Email draft generation
    63â†’  - X/Twitter draft generation
    64â†’  - LinkedIn draft generation
    65â†’- [ ] Implement Gemini 2.5 Pro integration
    66â†’- [ ] Add error handling for AI failures
    67â†’
    68â†’### 7. Background Processing
    69â†’- [ ] Implement simple job queue (in-memory or basic file-based)
    70â†’- [ ] Process one recording at a time
    71â†’- [ ] Handle job failures gracefully
    72â†’
    73â†’---
    74â†’
    75â†’## ğŸ¨ FRONTEND TASKS (Next.js + TypeScript)
    76â†’NOTE THE FRONTEND DOESNT READ FROM TEH BACKEND. IT LISTENS TO THE REALTIME DATABASE BY SUPABASE.
    77â†’FRONTEND WILL TALK TO BACKEND, but only to request writes.
    78â†’
    79â†’### 1. Dependencies & Setup
    80â†’- [ ] Add missing dependencies:
    81â†’  - `@supabase/supabase-js` (database client)
    82â†’  - `@radix-ui/react-*` (shadcn components)
    83â†’  - `class-variance-authority` (component variants)
    84â†’  - `clsx` + `tailwind-merge` (styling utilities)
    85â†’  - `lucide-react` (icons)
    86â†’  - `@hookform/resolvers` + `react-hook-form` (forms)
    87â†’  - `zod` (validation)
    88â†’- [ ] Set up shadcn/ui components
    89â†’- [ ] Configure biome for linting
    90â†’- [ ] Set up environment variables
    91â†’
    92â†’### 2. Database Integration
    93â†’- [ ] Configure Supabase client
    94â†’- [ ] Set up real-time subscriptions
    95â†’- [ ] Add authentication (basic email/password)
    96â†’
    97â†’### 3. Core Pages & Components
    98â†’- [ ] Dashboard page (`/`) - Video list with status badges
    99â†’- [ ] Video detail page (`/videos/[id]`) - Player + draft editor
   100â†’- [ ] Navigation component
   101â†’- [ ] Video status badges component
   102â†’- [ ] Draft editor component (textarea with save)
   103â†’- [ ] Feedback component
   104â†’
   105â†’### 4. Video Management UI
   106â†’- [ ] Import video form (Zoom meeting ID input)
   107â†’- [ ] Video list table with:
   108â†’  - Status indicators
   109â†’  - Title/duration
   110â†’  - Created date
   111â†’  - Action buttons
   112â†’- [ ] Video detail view with:
   113â†’  - Embedded YouTube player
   114â†’  - Summary points display
   115â†’  - Draft editing interface
   116â†’
   117â†’### 5. Draft Editing Interface
   118â†’- [ ] Three textarea fields (Email, X, LinkedIn)
   119â†’- [ ] Pre-fill with AI-generated content
   120â†’- [ ] Inline editing with save functionality
   121â†’- [ ] Version history display
   122â†’- [ ] Feedback input form
   123â†’
   124â†’### 6. Real-time Updates
   125â†’- [ ] Subscribe to video status changes
   126â†’- [ ] Auto-refresh when drafts are updated
   127â†’- [ ] Loading states for all async operations
   128â†’
   129â†’---
   130â†’
   131â†’## ğŸ”§ INTEGRATION TASKS
   132â†’
   133â†’### 1. API Integration
   134â†’- [ ] Create TypeScript types for all API responses
   135â†’- [ ] Implement API client functions
   136â†’- [ ] Add error handling for API calls
   137â†’- [ ] Add loading states for all operations
   138â†’
   139â†’### 2. Environment Setup
   140â†’- [ ] Create `.env.local` for frontend secrets
   141â†’- [ ] Create `.env` for backend secrets
   142â†’- [ ] Document all required environment variables
   143â†’
   144â†’### 3. Development Workflow
   145â†’- [ ] Set up hot reload for both frontend/backend
   146â†’- [ ] Add basic error logging
   147â†’- [ ] Test OAuth flows end-to-end
   148â†’- [ ] Test video upload pipeline
   149â†’
   150â†’---
   151â†’
   152â†’## ğŸš« OUT OF SCOPE (V0)
   153â†’- CI/CD pipelines
   154â†’- Advanced analytics
   155â†’- Rich WYSIWYG editors
   156â†’- Auto-publishing to social media
   157â†’- Scheduling functionality
   158â†’- Advanced job queues
   159â†’- Complex retry logic
   160â†’- Performance optimizations
   161â†’- Advanced security features
   162â†’
   163â†’---
   164â†’
   165â†’## ğŸ¯ SUCCESS CRITERIA
   166â†’1. User can import Zoom recording via meeting ID
   167â†’2. Video appears on YouTube as unlisted
   168â†’3. AI generates 3 draft texts (email, X, LinkedIn)
   169â†’4. User can edit drafts in web UI
   170â†’5. All changes persist to database
   171â†’6. Real-time updates work
   172â†’7. Basic error handling in place
   173â†’
   174â†’---
   175â†’
   176â†’## ğŸ“ NOTES
   177â†’- Keep it simple - this is a hackathon project
   178â†’- Focus on core functionality over polish
   179â†’- Use existing libraries and tools
   180â†’- Test manually rather than automated tests
   181â†’- Deploy to local development only

1â†’# Automated Video Summarization & Draft Distribution â€“ **V0 Specification**
     2â†’
     3â†’> **Focus**: Build the thinnest slice that turns a Zoom cloud recording into (1) an unlisted YouTube video and (2) three AIâ€‘generated text drafts (email, X, LinkedIn) that a human can review and edit inside a single web UI. **No autoâ€‘publishing, scheduling, or advanced analytics in V0.**
     4â†’
     5â†’---
     6â†’
     7â†’## 1 Scope
     8â†’
     9â†’| Inâ€‘scope (V0 MVP)                                                                 | Outâ€‘ofâ€‘scope (deferred)                |
    10â†’| --------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------------- |
    11â†’| â€¢ OAuth connections for Zoom & Google (YouTube)                                   | X / LinkedIn OAuth & direct publishing |
    12â†’| â€¢ Download Zoom recording to backend                                              | Rich WYSIWYG editor, comment threads   |
    13â†’| â€¢ Upload video to YouTube as *Unlisted*                                           | Metrics, analytics, dashboards         |
    14â†’| â€¢ Send video URL to GeminiÂ 2.5Â Pro â†’ get \`\`                                     | Autoâ€‘transcription outside Gemini      |
    15â†’| â€¢ Generate email / X / LinkedIn copy via prompt template                          | Prompt designer UI, multiple templates |
    16â†’| â€¢ Persist artefacts & status in Supabase                                          | Job retries UI, observability stack    |
    17â†’| â€¢ Next.js UI: list videos, display draft text fields, allow inline edits & "Save" | â€œApprove & publishâ€, scheduling flows  |
    18â†’
    19â†’---
    20â†’
    21â†’## 2 Architecture Snapshot (V0)
    22â†’
    23â†’```
    24â†’Zoom  â”€â”€â–º FastAPI backend â”€â”€â–º YouTube (unlisted)
    25â†’                   â”‚
    26â†’                   â””â”€â–º Gemini 2.5 Pro â”€â”€â–º summary_points
    27â†’                                     â”‚
    28â†’Supabase  â—€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”´â”€ store video & drafts
    29â†’    â–²
    30â†’    â”‚  realtime
    31â†’Next.js UI  â—€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
    32â†’```
    33â†’
    34â†’* **Backend** (PythonÂ 3.12Â + FastAPI) handles Zoom â†’ YouTube â†’ Gemini pipeline.
    35â†’* **Database**: Supabase Postgres; tables: `videos`, `drafts`.
    36â†’* **Frontend** (Next.jsÂ 14, TypeScript) subscribes to Supabase to liveâ€‘refresh UI.
    37â†’
    38â†’---
    39â†’
    40â†’## 3 Data Model (updated for summary + feedback)
    41â†’
    42â†’```sql
    43â†’-- videos (one row per recording)
    44â†’CREATE TYPE video_status AS ENUM ('new','downloaded','uploaded','summarised','error');
    45â†’CREATE TABLE videos (
    46â†’  id uuid PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(),
    47â†’  zoom_meeting_id text NOT NULL,
    48â†’  youtube_video_id text,
    49â†’  transcript jsonb NOT NULL,
    50â†’  status video_status DEFAULT 'new',
    51â†’  title text,
    52â†’  created_at timestamptz DEFAULT now(),
    53â†’  points jsonb,          -- ordered bullet points (null if not summarised)
    54â†’);
    55â†’
    56â†’-- drafts (versioned per channel)
    57â†’CREATE TYPE draft_channel AS ENUM ('email','x','linkedin');
    58â†’CREATE TABLE drafts (
    59â†’  id uuid PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(),
    60â†’  video_id uuid REFERENCES videos(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    61â†’  channel draft_channel NOT NULL,
    62â†’  version int NOT NULL DEFAULT 1, -- 1 = first AI generation
    63â†’  content text NOT NULL,
    64â†’  generated bool DEFAULT true,    -- false once edited by human
    65â†’  created_at timestamptz DEFAULT now()
    66â†’);
    67â†’CREATE UNIQUE INDEX drafts_unique_channel_version ON drafts(video_id, channel, version);
    68â†’
    69â†’-- feedback on individual draft versions
    70â†’CREATE TABLE feedback (
    71â†’  id uuid PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(),
    72â†’  draft_id uuid REFERENCES drafts(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    73â†’  user_id uuid REFERENCES auth.users(id),
    74â†’  body text NOT NULL,
    75â†’  created_at timestamptz DEFAULT now()
    76â†’);
    77â†’```
    78â†’
    79â†’---
    80â†’
    81â†’## 4 Key API Endpoints (Backend â†’ Frontend)
    82â†’
    83â†’| Method                                 | Path                                                                                                  | Purpose |
    84â†’| -------------------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------- |
    85â†’| `POST /videos/import`                  | Body: `{zoom_meeting_id}` â†’ queues download job; returns `{video_id}`                                 |         |
    86â†’| `GET  /videos/{id}`                    | Returns Video DTO incl. latest summary & current drafts                                               |         |
    87â†’| `POST /videos/{id}/summarize`          | Triggers Gemini pipeline; creates `summary` row + firstâ€‘gen drafts                                    |         |
    88â†’| `GET  /videos/{id}/summary`            | Returns persisted `summary_points` JSON                                                               |         |
    89â†’| `GET  /videos/{id}/drafts?channel={c}` | List draft history (ordered by `version`)                                                             |         |
    90â†’| `POST /video/{id}/drafts`              | Body: `{content}`Â Â + `{channel}` â†’Â  adds new content with next version number, sets `generated=false` |         |
    91â†’| `POST /drafts/{id}/feedback`           | Body: `{body}` â†’ create feedback row + create a new draft (version++)                                 |         |
    92â†’|                                        |                                                                                                       |         |
    93â†’
    94â†’All DTOs generated via **pydantic** and served through FastAPIâ€™s OpenAPI schema.
    95â†’
    96â†’---
    97â†’
    98â†’## 5 UI Flow (Next.js)
    99â†’
   100â†’1. **Dashboard** â€“ table of recordings (status badges).
   101â†’2. **Detail Page** â€“ left: embedded YouTube player; right: three textarea fields preâ€‘filled with AI drafts.
   102â†’
   103â†’   1. **Save** button persists updates to `drafts` table via RPC.
   104â†’   2. Feedback section
   105â†’
   106â†’*(No approval/publish buttons in V0)*
   107â†’
   108â†’---
   109â†’
   110â†’## 6 Nonâ€‘Functional Targets
   111â†’
   112â†’DO NOT DO ANY OF THESE ACTION YET UNLESS SPECIFICALLY TOLD TO.
   113â†’
   114â†’* **Throughput**: one recording processed at a time; queue depth â‰¤10 acceptable.
   115â†’* **Latency**: â‰¤10Â min from import to drafts (network & Gemini latency bound).
   116â†’* **Security**: Supabase RLS â€” users can only see their own rows. Secrets in env vars.
   117â†’* **CI**: lint + unit tests; deploy backend to Fly.io, frontend to Vercel.
   118â†’
   119â†’---
   120â†’
   121â†’---
   122â†’
   123â†’## Stack Guidelines
   124â†’
   125â†’- Frontend - ONLY USE NPX and NPM. Use React and nextjs, use shadcn ONLY for ui components, biomejs for linting
   126â†’- Python - ONLY USE UV and UVX - not pip, not pipx, not poetry
   127â†’- AI - Use BAML
   128â†’
   129â†’
   130â†’

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it looks malicious. If it does, you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer high-level questions about the code behavior.

content.text: The files do not appear malicious - they seem to be a legitimate development project for an AI content pipeline application. Let me review the current backend implementation to understand what's already been done:

content.content:
1â†’from fastapi import FastAPI, HTTPException, status
     2â†’from fastapi.middleware.cors import CORSMiddleware
     3â†’from typing import List, Optional
     4â†’import uuid
     5â†’from datetime import datetime
     6â†’import os
     7â†’from dotenv import load_dotenv
     8â†’
     9â†’from models import (
    10â†’    VideoImportRequest, DraftUpdateRequest, FeedbackRequest,
    11â†’    Video, Draft, Feedback,
    12â†’    VideoImportResponse, VideoResponse, SummaryResponse, 
    13â†’    DraftsListResponse, DraftSaveResponse, FeedbackResponse, StatusResponse,
    14â†’    ZoomRecordingsResponse, ZoomRecording,
    15â†’    ZoomMeetingRecordings, ZoomMeetingsResponse
    16â†’)
    17â†’from database import db
    18â†’from zoom_client import zoom_client
    19â†’
    20â†’# Load environment variables
    21â†’load_dotenv()
    22â†’
    23â†’app = FastAPI(title="AI Content Pipeline API", version="1.0.0")
    24â†’
    25â†’# CORS middleware
    26â†’app.add_middleware(
    27â†’    CORSMiddleware,
    28â†’    allow_origins=["http://localhost:3000"],  # Frontend URL
    29â†’    allow_credentials=True,
    30â†’    allow_methods=["*"],
    31â†’    allow_headers=["*"],
    32â†’)
    33â†’
    34â†’
    35â†’# Validate required environment variables
    36â†’required_env_vars = ["SUPABASE_URL", "SUPABASE_ANON_KEY"]
    37â†’for var in required_env_vars:
    38â†’    if not os.getenv(var):
    39â†’        print(f"WARNING: {var} environment variable not set")
    40â†’
    41â†’@app.get("/")
    42â†’async def root():
    43â†’    return {"message": "AI Content Pipeline API"}
    44â†’
    45â†’@app.post("/videos/import", status_code=status.HTTP_202_ACCEPTED, response_model=VideoImportResponse)
    46â†’async def import_video(request: VideoImportRequest):
    47â†’    """Queue Zoom download - returns video ID immediately"""
    48â†’    video_id = str(uuid.uuid4())
    49â†’    
    50â†’    # Create video record
    51â†’    video = Video(
    52â†’        id=video_id,
    53â†’        title=f"Zoom Meeting {request.zoom_meeting_id}",
    54â†’        duration=3600,  # 1 hour
    55â†’        status="processing",
    56â†’        created_at=datetime.now()
    57â†’    )
    58â†’    
    59â†’    try:
    60â†’        await db.create_video(video)
    61â†’        return VideoImportResponse(video_id=video_id, status="queued")
    62â†’    except Exception as e:
    63â†’        raise HTTPException(status_code=status.HTTP_500_INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR, detail=str(e))
    64â†’
    65â†’@app.get("/videos/{video_id}", response_model=VideoResponse)
    66â†’async def get_video(video_id: str):
    67â†’    """Get video details + drafts"""
    68â†’    try:
    69â†’        video = await db.get_video(video_id)
    70â†’        if not video:
    71â†’            raise HTTPException(status_code=status.HTTP_404_NOT_FOUND, detail="Video not found")
    72â†’        
    73â†’        video_drafts = await db.get_drafts_by_video(video_id)
    74â†’        return VideoResponse(video=video, drafts=video_drafts)
    75â†’    except HTTPException:
    76â†’        raise
    77â†’    except Exception as e:
    78â†’        raise HTTPException(status_code=status.HTTP_500_INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR, detail=str(e))
    79â†’
    80â†’@app.post("/videos/{video_id}/summarize", status_code=status.HTTP_202_ACCEPTED, response_model=StatusResponse)
    81â†’async def trigger_summarize(video_id: str):
    82â†’    """Trigger Gemini pipeline"""
    83â†’    try:
    84â†’        video = await db.get_video(video_id)
    85â†’        if not video:
    86â†’            raise HTTPException(status_code=status.HTTP_404_NOT_FOUND, detail="Video not found")
    87â†’        
    88â†’        # Simulate processing - update status and add sample summary points
    89â†’        updates = {
    90â†’            "status": "processing",
    91â†’            "summary_points": [
    92â†’                "Key point 1: Introduction to AI content pipeline",
    93â†’                "Key point 2: Benefits of automated content generation",
    94â†’                "Key point 3: Best practices for implementation"
    95â†’            ]
    96â†’        }
    97â†’        
    98â†’        await db.update_video(video_id, updates)
    99â†’        return StatusResponse(status="summarization started")
   100â†’    except HTTPException:
   101â†’        raise
   102â†’    except Exception as e:
   103â†’        raise HTTPException(status_code=status.HTTP_500_INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR, detail=str(e))
   104â†’
   105â†’@app.get("/videos/{video_id}/summary", response_model=SummaryResponse)
   106â†’async def get_summary(video_id: str):
   107â†’    """Get summary points"""
   108â†’    try:
   109â†’        video = await db.get_video(video_id)
   110â†’        if not video:
   111â†’            raise HTTPException(status_code=status.HTTP_404_NOT_FOUND, detail="Video not found")
   112â†’        
   113â†’        return SummaryResponse(summary_points=video.summary_points or [])
   114â†’    except HTTPException:
   115â†’        raise
   116â†’    except Exception as e:
   117â†’        raise HTTPException(status_code=status.HTTP_500_INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR, detail=str(e))
   118â†’
   119â†’@app.get("/videos/{video_id}/drafts", response_model=DraftsListResponse)
   120â†’async def list_drafts(video_id: str):
   121â†’    """List draft history"""
   122â†’    try:
   123â†’        video = await db.get_video(video_id)
   124â†’        if not video:
   125â†’            raise HTTPException(status_code=status.HTTP_404_NOT_FOUND, detail="Video not found")
   126â†’

   128â†’        return DraftsListResponse(drafts=video_drafts)
   129â†’    except HTTPException:
   130â†’        raise
   131â†’    except Exception as e:
   132â†’        raise HTTPException(status_code=status.HTTP_500_INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR, detail=str(e))
   133â†’
   134â†’@app.post("/videos/{video_id}/drafts", response_model=DraftSaveResponse)
   135â†’async def save_drafts(video_id: str, request: DraftUpdateRequest):
   136â†’    """Save edited drafts"""

   138â†’        video = await db.get_video(video_id)
   139â†’        if not video:
   140â†’            raise HTTPException(status_code=status.HTTP_404_NOT_FOUND, detail="Video not found")
   141â†’        
   142â†’        draft_id = str(uuid.uuid4())
   143â†’        
   144â†’        # Create new draft
   145â†’        draft = Draft(
   146â†’            id=draft_id,
   147â†’            video_id=video_id,
   148â†’            email_content=request.email_content,
   149â†’            x_content=request.x_content,
   150â†’            linkedin_content=request.linkedin_content,
   151â†’            created_at=datetime.now(),
   152â†’            version=1
   153â†’        )
   154â†’        
   155â†’        await db.create_draft(draft)
   156â†’        return DraftSaveResponse(draft_id=draft_id, status="saved")
   157â†’    except HTTPException:
   158â†’        raise
   159â†’    except Exception as e:
   160â†’        raise HTTPException(status_code=status.HTTP_500_INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR, detail=str(e))
   161â†’
   162â†’@app.post("/drafts/{draft_id}/feedback", response_model=FeedbackResponse)
   163â†’async def add_feedback(draft_id: str, request: FeedbackRequest):
   164â†’    """Add feedback"""
   165â†’    try:
   166â†’        draft = await db.get_draft(draft_id)
   167â†’        if not draft:
   168â†’            raise HTTPException(status_code=status.HTTP_404_NOT_FOUND, detail="Draft not found")
   169â†’        
   170â†’        feedback_id = str(uuid.uuid4())
   171â†’        
   172â†’        feedback = Feedback(
   173â†’            id=feedback_id,
   174â†’            draft_id=draft_id,
   175â†’            content=request.content,
   176â†’            created_at=datetime.now()
   177â†’        )
   178â†’        
   179â†’        await db.create_feedback(feedback)
   180â†’        return FeedbackResponse(feedback_id=feedback_id, status="added")
   181â†’    except HTTPException:
   182â†’        raise
   183â†’    except Exception as e:
   184â†’        raise HTTPException(status_code=status.HTTP_500_INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR, detail=str(e))
   185â†’
   186â†’@app.get("/test/supabase")
   187â†’async def test_supabase():
   188â†’    """Test Supabase connection and credentials"""
   189â†’    try:

   191â†’        from database import db
   192â†’        # Try a basic operation
   193â†’        return {"status": "connected", "message": "Supabase credentials valid"}
   194â†’    except Exception as e:
   195â†’        raise HTTPException(status_code=status.HTTP_500_INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR, 
   196â†’                          detail=f"Supabase connection failed: {str(e)}")
   197â†’
   198â†’@app.get("/test/zoom")  
   199â†’async def test_zoom():
   200â†’    """Test Zoom API credentials"""
   201â†’    zoom_api_key = os.getenv("ZOOM_API_KEY")
   202â†’    zoom_api_secret = os.getenv("ZOOM_API_SECRET")
   203â†’    
   204â†’    if not zoom_api_key or not zoom_api_secret:
   205â†’        raise HTTPException(status_code=status.HTTP_500_INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR,
   206â†’                          detail="Zoom API credentials not configured")
   207â†’    
   208â†’    try:
   209â†’        # Simple credentials validation
   210â†’        return {"status": "configured", "message": "Zoom API credentials found"}
   211â†’    except Exception as e:
   212â†’        raise HTTPException(status_code=status.HTTP_500_INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR,
   213â†’                          detail=f"Zoom API test failed: {str(e)}")
   214â†’
   215â†’@app.get("/zoom/recordings", response_model=ZoomMeetingsResponse)
   216â†’async def get_zoom_recordings(
   217â†’    from_date: Optional[str] = None,
   218â†’    to_date: Optional[str] = None,
   219â†’    user_id: str = "me"
   220â†’):
   221â†’    """Fetch existing Zoom recordings, grouped by meeting"""
   222â†’    try:
   223â†’        recordings_data = zoom_client.get_recordings(
   224â†’            user_id=user_id,
   225â†’            from_date=from_date,
   226â†’            to_date=to_date
   227â†’        )
   228â†’        # Group by meeting_id
   229â†’        meetings = {}
   230â†’        for rec in recordings_data:
   231â†’            m_id = rec["meeting_id"]
   232â†’            if m_id not in meetings:
   233â†’                meetings[m_id] = {
   234â†’                    "meeting_id": m_id,
   235â†’                    "meeting_title": rec["meeting_title"],
   236â†’                    "recording_start": rec["recording_start"],
   237â†’                    "recording_end": rec["recording_end"],
   238â†’                    "recordings": []
   239â†’                }
   240â†’            meetings[m_id]["recordings"].append(ZoomRecording(**rec))
   241â†’        meetings_list = [ZoomMeetingRecordings(**m) for m in meetings.values()]
   242â†’        return ZoomMeetingsResponse(
   243â†’            meetings=meetings_list,
   244â†’            total_count=len(meetings_list)
   245â†’        )
   246â†’    except Exception as e:
   247â†’        raise HTTPException(
   248â†’            status_code=status.HTTP_500_INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR,
   249â†’            detail=f"Failed to fetch Zoom recordings: {str(e)}"
   250â†’        )
   251â†’
   252â†’if __name__ == "__main__":
   253â†’    import uvicorn
   254â†’    port = int(os.getenv("PORT", 8000))
   255â†’    uvicorn.run("main:app", host="0.0.0.0", port=port, reload=True)

input.content:
-- AI Content Pipeline Database Schema
-- Based on README.md specification and current models.py

-- Enable UUID generation
CREATE EXTENSION IF NOT EXISTS "uuid-ossp";

-- Video status enum
CREATE TYPE video_status AS ENUM ('new','downloaded','uploaded','summarised','error');

-- Draft channel enum  
CREATE TYPE draft_channel AS ENUM ('email','x','linkedin');

-- Videos table (one row per recording)
CREATE TABLE videos (
  id uuid PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4(),
  zoom_meeting_id text NOT NULL,
  youtube_video_id text,
  transcript jsonb,
  status video_status DEFAULT 'new',
  title text,
  duration int, -- seconds
  youtube_url text,
  created_at timestamptz DEFAULT now(),
  points jsonb -- ordered bullet points (null if not summarised)
);

-- Drafts table (versioned per channel)
CREATE TABLE drafts (
  id uuid PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4(),
  video_id uuid REFERENCES videos(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
  channel draft_channel NOT NULL,
  version int NOT NULL DEFAULT 1, -- 1 = first AI generation
  content text NOT NULL,
  generated bool DEFAULT true,    -- false once edited by human
  created_at timestamptz DEFAULT now()
);

-- Ensure unique channel+version per video
CREATE UNIQUE INDEX drafts_unique_channel_version ON drafts(video_id, channel, version);

-- Feedback on individual draft versions
CREATE TABLE feedback (
  id uuid PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4(),
  draft_id uuid REFERENCES drafts(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
  user_id uuid REFERENCES auth.users(id),
  body text NOT NULL,
  created_at timestamptz DEFAULT now()
);

-- Indexes for performance
CREATE INDEX idx_videos_status ON videos(status);
CREATE INDEX idx_videos_created_at ON videos(created_at DESC);
CREATE INDEX idx_drafts_video_id ON drafts(video_id);
CREATE INDEX idx_drafts_channel ON drafts(channel);
CREATE INDEX idx_feedback_draft_id ON feedback(draft_id);

-- Row Level Security (RLS) Policies
-- Enable RLS on all tables
ALTER TABLE videos ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;
ALTER TABLE drafts ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;
ALTER TABLE feedback ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;

-- Videos policies - users can only see their own videos
-- For now, allow all operations since we don't have user auth implemented yet
CREATE POLICY "Allow all video operations" ON videos
  FOR ALL TO authenticated
  USING (true)
  WITH CHECK (true);

-- Drafts policies - users can only see drafts for their videos
CREATE POLICY "Allow all draft operations" ON drafts
  FOR ALL TO authenticated
  USING (true)
  WITH CHECK (true);

-- Feedback policies - users can only see feedback on their drafts
CREATE POLICY "Allow all feedback operations" ON feedback
  FOR ALL TO authenticated
  USING (true)
  WITH CHECK (true);

-- For development/testing, also allow anonymous access
CREATE POLICY "Allow anonymous video operations" ON videos
  FOR ALL TO anon
  USING (true)
  WITH CHECK (true);

CREATE POLICY "Allow anonymous draft operations" ON drafts
  FOR ALL TO anon
  USING (true)
  WITH CHECK (true);

CREATE POLICY "Allow anonymous feedback operations" ON feedback
  FOR ALL TO anon
  USING (true)
  WITH CHECK (true);

-- AI Content Pipeline Database Schema
-- Based on README.md specification and current models.py

-- Enable UUID generation
CREATE EXTENSION IF NOT EXISTS "uuid-ossp";

-- Video status enum
CREATE TYPE video_status AS ENUM ('new','downloaded','uploaded','summarised','error');

-- Draft channel enum  
CREATE TYPE draft_channel AS ENUM ('email','x','linkedin');

-- Videos table (one row per recording)
CREATE TABLE videos (
  id uuid PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4(),
  zoom_meeting_id text NOT NULL,
  youtube_video_id text,
  transcript jsonb,
  status video_status DEFAULT 'new',
  title text,
  duration int, -- seconds
  youtube_url text,
  created_at timestamptz DEFAULT now(),
  points jsonb -- ordered bullet points (null if not summarised)
);

-- Drafts table (versioned per channel)
CREATE TABLE drafts (
  id uuid PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4(),
  video_id uuid REFERENCES videos(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
  channel draft_channel NOT NULL,
  version int NOT NULL DEFAULT 1, -- 1 = first AI generation
  content text NOT NULL,
  generated bool DEFAULT true,    -- false once edited by human
  created_at timestamptz DEFAULT now()
);

-- Ensure unique channel+version per video
CREATE UNIQUE INDEX drafts_unique_channel_version ON drafts(video_id, channel, version);

-- Feedback on individual draft versions
CREATE TABLE feedback (
  id uuid PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4(),
  draft_id uuid REFERENCES drafts(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
  user_id uuid REFERENCES auth.users(id),
  body text NOT NULL,
  created_at timestamptz DEFAULT now()
);

-- Indexes for performance
CREATE INDEX idx_videos_status ON videos(status);
CREATE INDEX idx_videos_created_at ON videos(created_at DESC);
CREATE INDEX idx_drafts_video_id ON drafts(video_id);
CREATE INDEX idx_drafts_channel ON drafts(channel);
CREATE INDEX idx_feedback_draft_id ON feedback(draft_id);

-- Row Level Security (RLS) Policies
-- Enable RLS on all tables
ALTER TABLE videos ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;
ALTER TABLE drafts ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;
ALTER TABLE feedback ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;

-- Videos policies - users can only see their own videos
-- For now, allow all operations since we don't have user auth implemented yet
CREATE POLICY "Allow all video operations" ON videos
  FOR ALL TO authenticated
  USING (true)
  WITH CHECK (true);

-- Drafts policies - users can only see drafts for their videos
CREATE POLICY "Allow all draft operations" ON drafts
  FOR ALL TO authenticated
  USING (true)
  WITH CHECK (true);

-- Feedback policies - users can only see feedback on their drafts
CREATE POLICY "Allow all feedback operations" ON feedback
  FOR ALL TO authenticated
  USING (true)
  WITH CHECK (true);

-- For development/testing, also allow anonymous access
CREATE POLICY "Allow anonymous video operations" ON videos
  FOR ALL TO anon
  USING (true)
  WITH CHECK (true);

CREATE POLICY "Allow anonymous draft operations" ON drafts
  FOR ALL TO anon
  USING (true)
  WITH CHECK (true);

CREATE POLICY "Allow anonymous feedback operations" ON feedback
  FOR ALL TO anon
  USING (true)
  WITH CHECK (true);

-- AI Content Pipeline Database Schema
-- Based on README.md specification and current models.py

-- Enable UUID generation
CREATE EXTENSION IF NOT EXISTS "uuid-ossp";

-- Video status enum
CREATE TYPE video_status AS ENUM ('new','downloaded','uploaded','summarised','error');

-- Draft channel enum  
CREATE TYPE draft_channel AS ENUM ('email','x','linkedin');

-- Videos table (one row per recording)
CREATE TABLE videos (
  id uuid PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4(),
  zoom_meeting_id text NOT NULL,
  youtube_video_id text,
  transcript jsonb,
  status video_status DEFAULT 'new',
  title text,
  duration int, -- seconds
  youtube_url text,
  created_at timestamptz DEFAULT now(),
  points jsonb -- ordered bullet points (null if not summarised)
);

-- Drafts table (versioned per channel)
CREATE TABLE drafts (
  id uuid PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4(),
  video_id uuid REFERENCES videos(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
  channel draft_channel NOT NULL,
  version int NOT NULL DEFAULT 1, -- 1 = first AI generation
  content text NOT NULL,
  generated bool DEFAULT true,    -- false once edited by human
  created_at timestamptz DEFAULT now()
);

-- Ensure unique channel+version per video
CREATE UNIQUE INDEX drafts_unique_channel_version ON drafts(video_id, channel, version);

-- Feedback on individual draft versions
CREATE TABLE feedback (
  id uuid PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4(),
  draft_id uuid REFERENCES drafts(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
  user_id uuid REFERENCES auth.users(id),
  body text NOT NULL,
  created_at timestamptz DEFAULT now()
);

-- Indexes for performance
CREATE INDEX idx_videos_status ON videos(status);
CREATE INDEX idx_videos_created_at ON videos(created_at DESC);
CREATE INDEX idx_drafts_video_id ON drafts(video_id);
CREATE INDEX idx_drafts_channel ON drafts(channel);
CREATE INDEX idx_feedback_draft_id ON feedback(draft_id);

-- Row Level Security (RLS) Policies
-- Enable RLS on all tables
ALTER TABLE videos ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;
ALTER TABLE drafts ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;
ALTER TABLE feedback ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;

-- Videos policies - users can only see their own videos
-- For now, allow all operations since we don't have user auth implemented yet
CREATE POLICY "Allow all video operations" ON videos
  FOR ALL TO authenticated
  USING (true)
  WITH CHECK (true);

-- Drafts policies - users can only see drafts for their videos
CREATE POLICY "Allow all draft operations" ON drafts
  FOR ALL TO authenticated
  USING (true)
  WITH CHECK (true);

-- Feedback policies - users can only see feedback on their drafts
CREATE POLICY "Allow all feedback operations" ON feedback
  FOR ALL TO authenticated
  USING (true)
  WITH CHECK (true);

-- For development/testing, also allow anonymous access
CREATE POLICY "Allow anonymous video operations" ON videos
  FOR ALL TO anon
  USING (true)
  WITH CHECK (true);

CREATE POLICY "Allow anonymous draft operations" ON drafts

input.content:
-- AI Content Pipeline Database Schema
-- Based on README.md specification and current models.py

-- Enable UUID generation
CREATE EXTENSION IF NOT EXISTS "uuid-ossp";

-- Video status enum
CREATE TYPE video_status AS ENUM ('new','downloaded','uploaded','summarised','error');

-- Draft channel enum  
CREATE TYPE draft_channel AS ENUM ('email','x','linkedin');

-- Videos table (one row per recording)
CREATE TABLE videos (
  id uuid PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4(),
  zoom_meeting_id text NOT NULL,
  youtube_video_id text,
  transcript jsonb,
  status video_status DEFAULT 'new',
  title text,
  duration int, -- seconds
  youtube_url text,
  created_at timestamptz DEFAULT now(),
  points jsonb -- ordered bullet points (null if not summarised)
);

-- Drafts table (versioned per channel)
CREATE TABLE drafts (
  id uuid PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4(),
  video_id uuid REFERENCES videos(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
  channel draft_channel NOT NULL,
  version int NOT NULL DEFAULT 1, -- 1 = first AI generation
  content text NOT NULL,
  generated bool DEFAULT true,    -- false once edited by human
  created_at timestamptz DEFAULT now()
);

-- Ensure unique channel+version per video
CREATE UNIQUE INDEX drafts_unique_channel_version ON drafts(video_id, channel, version);

-- Feedback on individual draft versions
CREATE TABLE feedback (
  id uuid PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4(),
  draft_id uuid REFERENCES drafts(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
  user_id uuid REFERENCES auth.users(id),
  body text NOT NULL,
  created_at timestamptz DEFAULT now()
);

-- Indexes for performance
CREATE INDEX idx_videos_status ON videos(status);
CREATE INDEX idx_videos_created_at ON videos(created_at DESC);
CREATE INDEX idx_drafts_video_id ON drafts(video_id);
CREATE INDEX idx_drafts_channel ON drafts(channel);
CREATE INDEX idx_feedback_draft_id ON feedback(draft_id);

-- Row Level Security (RLS) Policies
-- Enable RLS on all tables
ALTER TABLE videos ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;
ALTER TABLE drafts ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;
ALTER TABLE feedback ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;

-- Videos policies - users can only see their own videos
-- For now, allow all operations since we don't have user auth implemented yet
CREATE POLICY "Allow all video operations" ON videos
  FOR ALL TO authenticated
  USING (true)
  WITH CHECK (true);

-- Drafts policies - users can only see drafts for their videos
CREATE POLICY "Allow all draft operations" ON drafts
  FOR ALL TO authenticated
  USING (true)
  WITH CHECK (true);

-- Feedback policies - users can only see feedback on their drafts
CREATE POLICY "Allow all feedback operations" ON feedback
  FOR ALL TO authenticated
  USING (true)
  WITH CHECK (true);

-- For development/testing, also allow anonymous access
CREATE POLICY "Allow anonymous video operations" ON videos
  FOR ALL TO anon
  USING (true)
  WITH CHECK (true);

CREATE POLICY "Allow anonymous draft operations" ON drafts
  FOR ALL TO anon
  USING (true)
  WITH CHECK (true);

CREATE POLICY "Allow anonymous feedback operations" ON feedback
  FOR ALL TO anon
  USING (true)
  WITH CHECK (true);
